documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy Policy Last Updated: 10/12/2019 Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy constitutes an agreement between you and Hackerwars.io ("Hackerwars.io", "Hacker Wars", "we", "us", "staff", "admin") regarding your access to and use of Hackerwars.io as well as any other media forms, channels, mobile website, channels, or other Hacker Wars material linked or connected (collectively termed the "site" and/or "Hackerwars.io").

We are committed and take seriously the duty of protecting your privacy and personal information. We will never sell your personal data nor will we abuse it to find out more information about you, other than what is used to play the game. If you ever have any questions or comments regarding this policy or anything privacy or security related, please contact compliance@hackerwars.io. or security@hackerwars.io.

In this policy, we will seek to describe to the best of our ability how we collect, use, and our boundary rights in regards to your information. We ask that you take the time to read this policy carefully along with our Terms of Service and Use.

Read this policy carefully. What Personal information do we collect?

At an overview, we collect information that you voluntarily provide us when registering such as your email, password, alias, security and host identifying data. We also collect any information that you upload such as in-game emails, profile pictures, and comments.

Information that we collect can vary depending on what you provide us but the information we can collect are:

  • Name/alias and contact data - We collect your email address and name/username.
  • Credentials - We collect passwords and other security information used for authentication, anti-cheating, account access, security information, and other similar information.

Any information that you provide us will be thought of as accurate. If there are any changes to your information (particularly relating to emails), you must notify us and update your information.

What's the privacy policy on gifts/donations?
  • Paypal - We will only see your account/account ID and it’s association with your Paypal to your Hackerwars.io account and whatever other information you give us. The information on Paypal is stored under only Paypal’s policy:

    • Paypal's Safety and Security Page

    Paypal's Privacy Policy Page

  • Bitcoin - Bitcoin is public and traceable on the bitcoin network. We can’t really see anything other than your bitcoin address and it’s association with your Hackerwars.io account.
Information automatically collected

At an overview, we collect information such as IP addresses, browser and device characteristics/information. Much of this information is automatically collected when you visit the website.

We automatically collect certain information when you visit or use the website. This information does not reveal specific personal information such as your name and contact information but it may include device/host information and usage such as IP addresses, browser and cookies, device/host characteristics, operating system, language preferences, location, country, and information about how you use our information. This information will be primarily needed to ensure security on the website, prevent cheating, and for our analytics and reporting processes.

As stated previously and I want to reiterate, we do collect information through cookies.

Information shared with third parties

We try to limit what information is shared but to provide you with services and to help manage the website, we do share some information legally.

Reasons for sharing may include legitimate business interests, legal obligations, and vital interests meaning we may use this information to investigate illegal activity, threats, and cheating.

Third parties and services - In addition, we may use your data to provide information to third party vendors and services. Examples include payment processing, data analytics, email delivery, hosting services, and marketing purposes. We may also allow selected third parties to do tracking activities to collect data interaction and content analytics.

Business transfers - We may also share and transfer information in the case of a merger, sale, financing, acquisition or part or of the whole website.

Third party advertisers - We may use a third party advertising company to serve ads when you visit the site. The company may use information about your visits to the website and other websites that contain cookies and tracking information to provide advertisements of goods and services that interest you.

Other users When you share or upload information in publicly viewable areas such as discord or in game logs or comments, your information may be viewed by all users and publicly distributed around the internet. In addition, other users will be able to view descriptions of your activity, communicate with you within our , and view your profile.

Use of cookies

To put it simply, we may use cookies and other tracking technologies to collect and store your information.

Information shared/transferred internationally

To start off, we may store, transfer, and process your information outside the country you reside. Our servers at the time of this policy creation are stored in the U.S. Please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed by us and by those third parties with whom we may share your personal information in your country and others around the world. If you are a resident in the European Economic Area, then these countries may not have data protection or other laws as comprehensive as those in your country. We will however take all necessary measures to protect your personal information in accordance with this privacy policy and applicable law. Additional notes on third-party websites

We are not responsible for your safety, privacy, or protection of information that you provide to third-party provides who advertise. Hackerwars.io may contain advertisements from third parties not affiliated with us. We cannot guarantee the safety and privacy of the data you provide to these parties. We are not responsible for any content, security, privacy, or policies of any third party websites, applications, or services that may be linked on our site. You should review the policy on those third parties or contact them directly if you have any questions.

How long do we keep your information?

We will keep your information for as long as necessary for the purpose of this privacy policy and for security, backup, and business reasons. When we permanently cease operations on this website and associates services and operations, we will either delete, anonymize, or if not immediately possible, we will store and isolate your information and work to delete it if possible.

Do we collect information on minors?

We do not solicit or specifically target children under 18 years of age. We also don’t require there to input their age. But by using this website, you represent that you are at least 18 years of age or that you are the parent or guardian of the represented minor and consent to the minor’s use of this website. If we learn that personal information from users less than 18 years of age has been collected outside the scope of what’s listed in this privacy policy, we will deactivate the account and take reasonable measures to promptly delete such data from our records. If you become aware of any such violation of this policy where data outside the scope of this policy is collected on minors under 18, please contact us at compliance@hackerwars.io.

Privacy rights

You may review, change, or terminate your existing account at any time.

You also have the right to request information we have on your account.

Account Information

You can at any time review or change the information in your account or terminate your account. If you do so, Upon your request to terminate your account, we will deactivate or delete your account and information from our active databases. However, some information may be retained in our files and backups to prevent fraud, troubleshoot problems, assist with any investigations, enforce our Terms of Service and Use and/or comply with legal requirements.

You can also opt out of email subscriptions and marketing by contacting us at contact@hackerwars.io until we setup an automated system to allow quick unsubscribes.

Do not track features

Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ("DNT") feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. No uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online. If a standard for online tracking is adopted that we must follow in the future, we will inform you about that practice in a revised version of this privacy policy.

Do we make updates to this policy?

Yes, we will try to update this policy to stay compliant with relevant laws. This website at the time of this policy writing is new and thus, we haven’t molded it completely to how we want it in the end. We will update this privacy policy when needed and updated versions will be indicated with a "revised" date. We also may notify you of notice of changes or email notifications. We encourage that you regularly read this privacy policy to stay informed.

Who’s the Data Protection Officer/Person in charge of documentation?

Username/Alias/Contact Name: Blackdawn
blackdawn@hackerwars.io.

Contact us about this policy

If you have any questions or comments relating to this policy, email us at compliance@hackerwars.io.

documents.name: Terms of Service and Use
documents.text:
Terms of Service and Use Last Updated: October 19th, 2019 Agreement to Terms

These Terms of Service and Use constitute a binding agreement between you and Hackerwars.io ("Hackerwars.io", Hacker Wars", "we", "us", "staff", "admin" ) regarding your access to and use of Hackerwars.io as well as any other media forms, channels, mobile website, channels, or other Hacker Wars material linked or connected (collectively termed the "site" and/or "Hackerwars.io").

By accessing and using Hackerwars.io, you agree that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and Use and Privacy Policy along with any relevant local laws. IF YOU DISAGREE WITH ANY PART OF THE TERMS OF SERVICE AND USE, YOU ARE PROHIBITED FROM ACCESSING AND USING THIS SITE AND MUST LEAVE THIS SITE IMMEDIATELY.

These Terms of Service and Use apply to all visitors, users, and others who access and use this website.

We reserve the right at our own discretion to make any changes or modifications at any time to the Terms of Service and Use. While efforts will be made to notify the community of any chances to the Terms of Service and Use, we will reserve the right to make changes without notice. It is your responsibility to regularly review the Terms of Service and Use. You will be subject to and deemed aware of and have accepted any changes that may occur to our Terms of Service and Use by your continued use of the site after the revision to the Terms of Service and Use.

Hackerwars.io is intended for users who are at least 13 years of age. All users who are minors who fall under the jurisdiction which they reside in must have the permission or direct supervision of their parent or guardian to use this website. If you are a minor, your parent or guardian must read and agree to these Terms of Service and Use before you use this site.

By using Hackerwars.io, you warrant that you have the legal capacity to agree to comply with these Terms of Service and Use. You also represent and warrant that you’re not located in any country or jurisdiction restricted and subject to a U.S government embargo or restriction. You also represent and warrant that you’re not listed in any U.S government list of prohibited or restricted parties.

You also agree to respect every member of the game regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, age, civil status, race, ethnicity, and any other train. You also agree to not post or publish any offensive content on the site. We reserve the right to remove or not to remove any content which are offensive. You also agree that staff members are free to interpret what is an what is not in violation of the Terms of Service and Use.

Registration

You will be required to register with the site. You agree to keep your password confidential and private to yourself as an individual. You will be responsible for the use of your account, content associated with your account, password, and any other information you provide or input to the website. You are responsible for providing a secure password and reliable email address. We reserve the right to remove, reclaim, restrict, ban, or modify your account and username at our own discretion. We are not responsible for any lost or restriction of access to your account or information.

Restrictions and Prohibited Activities

You may not use this site in connection to any commercial purposes without specific approval from the admin team. As a user of this website, you agree not to:

  1. Not use this site in a manner that violates any local and/or applicable laws and regulations.
  2. Threaten, harm, or conduct any activity that we deem harmful to us, other users, or the site.
  3. Posting or sharing non-public IPs.
  4. Harass, annoy, intimidate, or threaten any staff members or people who help provide any content or portion of the site to you.
  5. Use, develop, or distribute any automated or semi-automated system or script including and not limited to spiders, bots, scrapers, cheat utilities, data miners, data gathering or extraction tools, or offline readers that accesses the website or conducts any executions of any unauthorized script or software.
  6. Upload, distribute, or transmit (or attempts to upload, distribute, or transmit) viruses, trojan horses, spyware, or any other material or malware outside of the authorized in-game software used for gameplay.
  7. Copy, use, or modify the site’s software including and not limited to HTML, Javascript, PHP, CSS, and SQL.
  8. Delete or modify any license, copyright, or rights from any content.
  9. Decipher, decompile, or reverse engineer anything contained or associated with the site.
  10. Sell, transfer, or lend your account.
  11. Create multiple accounts. If you are in a shared environment, contact us.
  12. Impersonate or attempt to impersonate another user, person or entity.
  13. Interfere, disrupt, or create a burden on the site, networks, or services connected to the site.
  14. Engage in unauthorized framing or linking to the site.
  15. Trick, defraud, or social engineer the staff and other users, especially if it is an attempt to learn sensitive information such as passwords or private and personal information.
  16. Circumvent, disable, or interference with any security or anti-cheat related features on the site.
  17. Use the site as any part of an effort to copy or compete with us or the site in relation to any commercial, revenue-generating, or personal benefit.
  18. Make unauthorized use of the site by gathering data or information from the website such as usernames, emails, and other information for the purpose of automation or solicitation means.
  19. Systematically or automated retrieval of data or other content from the site to collect or compile without explicit permission from the full admin team.
  20. Alter or interfere with Hackerwars.io or gameplay in any way or form which includes but not limited to attempts at injections, browser scripts, browser extensions, macros, or bug/exploit abuse. Any vulnerability or bugs found need to be reported to security@hackerwars.io
Disclaimer

THE SITE IS PROVIDED ON AN AS-IS AND AS-AVAILABLE BASIS. YOU AGREE THAT YOUR USE OF THE SITE AND OUR SERVICES WILL BE AT YOUR SOLE RISK. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, IN CONNECTION WITH THE SITE AND YOUR USE THEREOF, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. WE MAKE NO WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS ABOUT THE ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF THE SITE’S CONTENT OR THE CONTENT OF ANY WEBSITES LINKED TO THE SITE AND WE WILL ASSUME NO LIABILITY OR RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY (1) ERRORS, MISTAKES, OR INACCURACIES OF CONTENT AND MATERIALS, (2) PERSONAL INJURY OR PROPERTY DAMAGE, OF ANY NATURE WHATSOEVER, RESULTING FROM YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF THE SITE, (3) ANY UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO OR USE OF OUR SECURE SERVERS AND/OR ANY AND ALL PERSONAL INFORMATION AND/OR FINANCIAL INFORMATION STORED THEREIN, (4) ANY INTERRUPTION OR CESSATION OF TRANSMISSION TO OR FROM THE SITE, (5) ANY BUGS, VIRUSES, TROJAN HORSES, OR THE LIKE WHICH MAY BE TRANSMITTED TO OR THROUGH THE SITE BY ANY THIRD PARTY, AND/OR (6) ANY ERRORS OR OMISSIONS IN ANY CONTENT AND MATERIALS OR FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE OF ANY KIND INCURRED AS A RESULT OF THE USE OF ANY CONTENT POSTED, TRANSMITTED, OR OTHERWISE MADE AVAILABLE VIA THE SITE. WE DO NOT WARRANT, ENDORSE, GUARANTEE, OR ASSUME RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY PRODUCT OR SERVICE ADVERTISED OR OFFERED BY A THIRD PARTY THROUGH THE SITE, ANY HYPERLINKED WEBSITE, OR ANY WEBSITE OR MOBILE APPLICATION FEATURED IN ANY BANNER OR OTHER ADVERTISING, AND WE WILL NOT BE A PARTY TO OR IN ANY WAY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING ANY TRANSACTION BETWEEN YOU AND ANY THIRD-PARTY PROVIDERS OF PRODUCTS OR SERVICES. AS WITH THE PURCHASE OF A PRODUCT OR SERVICE THROUGH ANY MEDIUM OR IN ANY ENVIRONMENT, YOU SHOULD USE YOUR BEST JUDGMENT AND EXERCISE CAUTION WHERE APPROPRIATE.

Third-Party Websites and Content

The site may contain (or you may be sent via the site) links to other websites ("Third-Party Websites") as well as articles, photographs, text, graphics, pictures, designs, music, sound, video, information, applications, software, and other content or items belonging to or originating from third parties ("Third-Party Content"). Such Third-Party Websites and Third-Party Content are not investigated, monitored, or checked for accuracy, appropriateness, or completeness by us, and we are not responsible for any Third-Party Websites accessed through the site or any Third-Party Content posted on, available through, or installed from the site, including the content, accuracy, offensiveness, opinions, reliability, privacy practices, or other policies of or contained in the Third-Party Websites or the Third-Party Content. Inclusion of, linking to, or permitting the use or installation of any Third-Party Websites or any Third-Party Content does not imply approval or endorsement thereof by us. If you decide to leave the site and access the Third-Party Websites or to use or install any Third-Party Content, you do so at your own risk, and you should be aware these Terms of Service and Use no longer govern. You should review the applicable terms and policies, including privacy and data gathering practices, of any website to which you navigate from the site or relating to any applications you use or install from the site. Any purchases you make through Third-Party Websites will be through other websites and from other companies, and we take no responsibility whatsoever in relation to such purchases which are exclusively between you and the applicable third party. You agree and acknowledge that we do not endorse the products or services offered on Third-Party Websites and you shall hold us harmless from any harm caused by your purchase of such products or services. Additionally, you shall hold us harmless from any losses sustained by you or harm caused to you relating to or resulting in any way from any Third-Party Content or any contact with Third-Party Websites.

Site Management

We reserve the right, but not the obligation, to: (1) monitor the site for violations of these Terms of Service and Use. (2) take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates the law or these Terms of Service and Use, including without limitation, reporting such user to law enforcement authorities. (3) in our sole discretion and without limitation, refuse, restrict access to, limit the availability of, or disable (to the extent technologically feasible) any of your Contributions or any portion thereof. (4) in our sole discretion and without limitation, notice, or liability, to remove from the Site or otherwise disable all files and content that are excessive in size or are in any way burdensome to our systems. and (5) otherwise manage the site in a manner designed to protect our rights and property and to facilitate the proper functioning of the site.

Modifications and Interruptions

We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the site at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. However, we have no obligation to update any information on our site. We also reserve the right to modify or discontinue all or part of the site without notice at any time. We will not be liable to you or any third party for any modification, price change, suspension, or discontinuance of the site.

We cannot guarantee the site will be available at all times. We may experience hardware, software, or other problems or need to perform maintenance related to the site, resulting in interruptions, delays, or errors. We reserve the right to change, revise, update, suspend, discontinue, or otherwise modify the site at any time or for any reason without notice to you. You agree that we have no liability whatsoever for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused by your inability to access or use the site during any downtime or discontinuance of the site. Nothing in these Terms of Service and Use will be construed to obligate us to maintain and support the site or to supply any corrections, updates, or releases in connection therewith. Hackerwars.io is a free to use website and it can be shutdown at amy moment without prior notice.

Limitations of Liability IN NO EVENT WILL WE OR OUR STAFF, OR REPRESENTATIVES BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFIT, LOST REVENUE, LOSS OF DATA, OR OTHER DAMAGES ARISING FROM YOUR USE OF THE SITE, EVEN IF WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. Links

Hackerwars.io has not reviewed all the sites linked to it’s website and is not responsible for any links posted on the site. Any links does not imply that it is allowed or endorsed by the site. The use and clicking on any links is at the user’s own risk.

Governing Law

These Terms of Service and Use and your use of the site are governed by the laws of the State of Washington and are applicable to agreements made.

Donations

All donations made to Hackerwars.io are final. Transactions cannot be disputed, reversed, or reclaimed without it being done in fraud. Nor will we offer any type of credit. If you are aware of any fraudulent activity of the use of your debit card, credit card, PayPal account, or other forms of financial payment services, you should report this to your card provider, PayPal, or service reporting services. Donations DO NOT exempt you from the rules, Terms of Serice and Use, and Privacy Policy. We reserve the right to change the donation tiers and model.

Rewards of any type may change or be revoked at any time without notice. Hackerwars.io makes no commitment and is not reliable to any changes or revokes that may occur.

A Couple More Notes...
  • We guarantee that every IP in-game is randomly generated and do not represent real user information
  • We will NEVER sell or rent your data to anyone
Contact

In order to resolve a complaint regarding the site or to receive further information regarding the use of the site, please contact us at: contact@hackerwars.io

points.title: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.
points.quoteText:
Do not track features

Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ("DNT") feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. No uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.

At an overview, we collect information such as IP addresses, browser and device characteristics/information.
